node.statement: (T_psi* mu_eps ~ mu_eps for each eps > 0) We prove this by computing the density of T_psi* mu_eps w.r.t. mu_0 and showing it is strictly positive mu_0-a.e. Let sigma = T_psi* mu_eps. For any measurable A: sigma(A) = mu_eps(T_psi^{-1}(A)) = integral_{T_psi^{-1}(A)} Z_eps^{-1} exp(-V_eps(phi)) dmu_0(phi). Applying the Cameron-Martin change of variables phi -> phi + psi with Jacobian d(T_psi* mu_0)/d(mu_0) from node 1.2.5, this equals integral_A Z_eps^{-1} exp(-V_eps(phi - psi)) exp(<(-Delta+m^2)psi, phi> - (1/2)||psi||^2_{H^1}) dmu_0(phi). Thus T_psi* mu_eps is absolutely continuous w.r.t. mu_0 with density f(phi) = Z_eps^{-1} exp(-V_eps(phi - psi)) exp(<(-Delta+m^2)psi, phi> - (1/2)||psi||^2_{H^1}). This density is strictly positive mu_0-a.e.: V_eps(phi - psi) is a.s. finite since (phi - psi)_eps = phi_eps - psi_eps is smooth (node 1.2.1 applies with phi replaced by phi - psi, noting T_{-psi}* mu_0 ~ mu_0 ensures phi - psi has full support under mu_0), and the Cameron-Martin exponential factor is always strictly positive. Hence T_psi* mu_eps ~ mu_0. Since also mu_eps ~ mu_0 (node 1.2.4), transitivity of mutual absolute continuity (if nu_1 ~ nu_2 and nu_2 ~ nu_3 then nu_1 ~ nu_3) gives T_psi* mu_eps ~ mu_eps. QED.
